mail.subject: T-Coffee alignment result
T-Coffee alignment result

module.name: regular
module.title: T-Coffee
module.description: Computes a multiple sequence alignment and the associated phylogenetic tree

fieldset.title: Sequences input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your set of sequences in FASTA format

validation.required-error: You have to enter the sequences to align
validation.format-error: Sequences have to be in FASTA format
validation.minnum-error: You must enter at least 2 sequences
validation.maxnum-error: You must enter at most 50 sequences

fieldset.title: Methods
fieldset.description: T-Coffee produces an alignment by combining the output of several alignment methods. Use this section to select the individual methods.

field.name: method1
field.label: Pairwise Methods
field.choices: best_pair4prot, fast_pair, clustalw_pair, lalign_id_pair, slow_pair, proba_pair

field.name: method3
field.label: Multiple Methods
field.choices: pcma_msa, mafft_msa, clustalw_msa, dialigntx_msa, poa_msa, muscle_msa, probcons_msa, t_coffee_msa

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, pir_aln, pir_seq, gcg, fasta_aln, fasta_seq, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion

module.name: expresso
module.title: Expresso
module.description: Structure based sequence alignments are potentially more accurate than simple sequence alignments

fieldset.title: Sequences input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your set of sequences in FASTA format

validation.required-error: You have to enter the sequences to align
validation.format-error: Sequences have to be in FASTA format
validation.minnum-error: You must enter at least 2 sequences
validation.maxnum-error: You must enter at most 50 sequences

fieldset.title: Structure(s) input
fieldset.description: Upload your PDB structure if needed (Do NOT upload Confidential Data!)

fieldset.title: Library Computation
fieldset.description: Select the methods you want to use to compute the library. T-Coffee uses various sequence and structure alignment methods to compile a collection of alignments known as a Library. Use this section to select the methods.

field.name: method1
field.label: Pairwise Methods
field.choices: best_pair4prot, fast_pair, clustalw_pair, lalign_id_pair, slow_pair, proba_pair

fieldset.title: PDB structure selection
fieldset.description: pecify which PDB structure (template) should be associated with which each sequence. The uploaded PDBs are automatically associated with their own sequence. Check the box to automatically fetch the templates, or fill the box and specify the sequence/template association

field.name: templateCheck
field.label: Automatically fetch pdb templates
field.hint: Check This Box To automatically Fetch Homologous Structures with BLAST

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, pir_aln, pir_seq, gcg, fasta_aln, fasta_seq, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion

module.name: mcoffee
module.title: M-Coffee
module.description: Computes a multiple sequence alignment and the associated phylogenetic tree by combining the output of several multiple sequence alignment packages (PCMA, Poa, Mafft, Muscle, T-Coffee, ClustalW, ProbCons, DialignTX).

fieldset.title: Sequences input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your set of sequences in FASTA format

validation.required-error: You have to enter the sequences to align
validation.format-error: Sequences have to be in FASTA format
validation.minnum-error: You must enter at least 2 sequences
validation.maxnum-error: You must enter at most 50 sequences

fieldset.title: Alignment Computation
fieldset.description: M-Coffee computes its alignments by combining a collection of Multiple Alignments named a Library. In this section you can select the methods you want to combine into the library. You can choose pairwise and multiple sequence alignment methods. The standard M-Coffee protocol only uses Multiple sequence alignment methods.

field.name: lib1
field.label: Pairwise Methods
field.choices: Mlalign_id_pair, Mclustalw_pair, Mpoa_pair, Mprobcons_pair, Mfast_pair, Mproba_pair, Mmafft_pair, Mdialigntx_pair, Mslow_pair, Mpcma_pair, Mmuscle_pair

field.name: lib2
field.label: Multiple Methods
field.value: Mpcma_msa, Mmafft_msa, Mclustalw_msa, Mdialigntx_msa, Mpoa_msa, Mmuscle_msa, Mprobcons_msa, Mt_coffee_msa
field.choices: Mpcma_msa, Mmafft_msa, Mclustalw_msa, Mdialigntx_msa, Mpoa_msa, Mmuscle_msa, Mprobcons_msa, Mt_coffee_msa

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, pir_aln, pir_seq, gcg, fasta_aln, fasta_seq, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion

module.name: rcoffee
module.title: R-Coffee
module.description: Multiple Sequence Alignment of Non-Coding RNA Sequences using RNAplfold predicted secondary structures.

fieldset.title: Sequences input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your set of sequences in FASTA format

validation.required-error: You have to enter the sequences to align
validation.format-error: Sequences have to be in FASTA format
validation.minnum-error: You must enter at least 2 sequences
validation.maxnum-error: You must enter at most 50 sequences

fieldset.title: Alignment Computation
fieldset.description: R-Coffee computes its alignments by combining a collection of Pairwise and Multiple Alignments named a Library. In this section you can select the methods you want to combine into the library. You can choose pairwise and multiple sequence alignment methods.

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, pir_aln, pir_seq, gcg, fasta_aln, fasta_seq, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion

module.name: combine
module.title: Combine
module.description: Combines two (or more) multiple sequence alignments into a single one.

fieldset.title: Sequences input
fieldset.description: Upload each of the Multiple Sequence alignments you want to combine. The alignments must be in fasta or clustal format. You need at least two alignments.

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, pir_aln, pir_seq, gcg, fasta_aln, fasta_seq, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion

module.name: core
module.title: Core
module.description: Evaluates your Alignment and outputs a Colored version where unreliable portions are in blue and the reliable ones in red.

fieldset.title: Alignment input
fieldset.description: Paste or upload your Multiple Sequence Alignment in CLUSTAL format.

fieldset.title: Library Computation
fieldset.description: Your alignment is evaluated by comparison against a collection of alignments. This collection is named a Library. This section lets you control the computation of the library. Different libraries give different score results

fieldset.title: Output options
fieldset.description: Use this section to control the output format.

field.name: output
field.label: Alignment format
field.choices: score_html, clustalw_aln, pir_aln, pir_seq, gcg, fasta_aln, fasta_seq, score_ascii, msf_aln, phylip

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion

module.name: irmsd
module.title: iRMSD-APDB
module.description: Evaluates your Multiple Sequence Alignment using APDB.

fieldset.title: Srad - the Sphere Radius
fieldset.description: APDB is a local method and the structural neighbourhood of each residue is used to estimate its alignment accuracy. This Neighbourhood is a sphere of radius Srad (in Ångström). A sphere with a 10 Ångström Radius contains between 20-40 amino acids.

field.name: srad
field.label: Srad
field.hint: Set Srad, the Sphere radius (Ångström). High Srad <=> More stringent measure

fieldset.title: T1 - the Distance Threshold
fieldset.description: Within a sphere, each pair of aligned residues either agrees or disagrees with the central residues alignment. Pairs of aligned residues whose difference of distance (Delta) is lower than T1 are considered to be supportive, pairs of residues above T1 are considered unsupportive.

field.name: t1
field.label: T1
field.hint: T1 (Ångström) the Delta Threshold. Low T1 <=> More stringent measure.

fieldset.title: T2 - the Neighbourhood Support
fieldset.description: The final APDB score indicates the proportion of aligned residues correctly aligned from an APDB point of view. APDB considers that a pair of residues is correctly aligned if T2 percent of its neighbourhood is supportive (as defined above in the T1 section).

field.name: t2
field.label: T2
field.hint: T2 (%) The Neighbourhood Support Limit. Hight T2 <=> More stringent Measure.

field.name: email
field.label: Your email address
field.hint: It will be used to notify you on alignment completion
